intro: Conostylis setigera, commonly known as the slender false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and heathlands. Its flowers are usually pale green to yellowish in color and bloom during the spring and summer months. Conostylis setigera is an important component of its native ecosystems and is often used in restoration projects due to its hardy nature.
